title: edition idioms: Incorrect span in `extern crate` removal

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-incorrect
labels.description: A diagnostic that is giving misleading or incorrect information

body:
[First reported upstream](https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/6360) this code:

```rust
#![warn(rust_2018_idioms)]

#[cfg_attr(test, macro_use)]
extern crate itertools;

use itertools::Itertools;

fn main() {
    println!("{:?}", (0..1).collect_vec());
}
```

[when compiled](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=beta&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=04ce404ce50b4ad3ab21582d8556d382) yields:

```
warning: unused extern crate
 --> src/main.rs:4:1
  |
4 | extern crate itertools;
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: remove it
  |
note: lint level defined here
 --> src/main.rs:1:9
  |
1 | #![warn(rust_2018_idioms)]
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: #[warn(unused_extern_crates)] implied by #[warn(rust_2018_idioms)]
```

but the suggestion is incorrect! Both the `extern crate` and the attribute on the item should be removed.
